intro: Asperula cynanchica var. rupicola, commonly known as the rock asperula, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. This variety is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to tolerate harsh environmental conditions.
